followups.ask: How long has the fever been present? (e.g., 2 days, 36 hours)
What’s the highest temperature you’ve noted? (C or F)

fever.self_care: Hydration, rest, temperature monitoring; people often consider paracetamol per label if suitable.
fever.when_to_see: See a clinician if fever persists >3 days, severe symptoms develop, or you’re worried.

followups.ask: What day of illness are you on, or how long since your positive test?
What’s the highest temperature you’ve noted? (C or F)
Do you have a SpO₂/pulse-ox reading at rest? (e.g., 97%)

covid.self_care: Isolate per local guidance, rest, hydrate, monitor temperature and breathing; people often consider paracetamol per label if suitable.
tests: If high-risk or worsening: clinician review
Consider chest X-ray if persistent cough/SOB
Clinicians may consider antivirals if high-risk and early in illness
covid.when_to_see: Seek care if breathing worsens, SpO₂ ≤ 92%, chest pain, confusion, or you’re worried.

followups.ask: How long has the back pain been present?
Where is it most intense (lower back, one side, radiating)?
On a scale of 0–10, how bad is it at rest?

back_pain.self_care: Relative rest 24–48h, heat/ice, gentle mobility & core stretches; avoid heavy lifting. People sometimes consider paracetamol per label if appropriate.
tests: MRI lumbar spine if persistent >2–6 weeks or neurologic signs
back_pain.when_to_see: See a clinician if pain is severe, persistent, or red flags appear.

followups.ask: How long have these symptoms been present?

_generic_respiratory.self_care: Rest, fluids, saline rinse/steam inhalation; avoid smoke/irritants.
tests: If >3 weeks or worsening: clinician review; chest X-ray may be considered
_generic_respiratory.when_to_see: See a clinician if symptoms are severe, persistent, or red flags appear.
